'''Forfalas''' was the northern half of the region of [[Falas]], located south of [[Nevrast]], and northwest of [[Eglamar (Falas)|Eglamar]].<ref name=For/><ref name=Bel/>

The region of Forfalas was marked on ''[[the Second 'Silmarillion' Map]]'',<ref name=For>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, ''Sheet 1 North-west'', p. 182</ref> which formed the basis for the [[Map of Beleriand and the Lands to the North|map of Beleriand]] in the published ''[[Silmarillion]]''.<ref>{{LR|A3}}, pp. 407-413</ref>

However, apart from being labeled on the aforementioned map, Forfalas was never mentioned again, nor did it appear in any of the narratives, annals or essays set in the [[First Age]].<ref name=Bel>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, "North-western section", ยง21, pp. 186-7</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Forfalas'' is in [[Sindarin]], meaning "North [[Falas]]". It is a combination of the prefixal form ''[[forn (Sindarin word)|for-]]'' ("north") + ''[[Falas#Etymology|falas]]'' ("shore").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1813281377.html|articlename=S. ''Forfalas'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=24 November 2023}}</ref>
